items.sentence: The optimist looks into a mirror and becomes more optimistic, the pessimist more pessimistic.
When we started out, our band could only find small clubs in small cities that would hire us.
While Tom was away from his desk, Mary drew a caricature of him on the cover of his notebook.
I never thought this rubber band would come in handy when I put it in my pocket this morning.
Right now, we have blueberries, blackberries, cherries, strawberries, peaches and nectarines.
Tom would\'ve liked to attend Mary\'s party. Unfortunately, he had other things he had to do.
Tom didn\'t need to look at the menu because he\'d been to that restaurant many times before.
Tom looked through all his desk drawers, but he still couldn\'t find what he was looking for.
Tom can\'t work as a doctor in Australia because his qualifications aren\'t recognized there.
If only I\'d left home five minutes earlier, I would\'ve gotten to the train station in time.
It's a dirty trick to close every polling station in areas that would vote for your opponent.
There was a sign at the hotel where I stayed that said durian wasn't allowed on the premises.
Even people with perfect pitch sometimes have a hard time with Mandarin, let alone Cantonese.
I thought people would want to buy these, but so far I haven't been able to sell any of them.
Just because something is bad for your enemy doesn't necessarily mean that it's good for you.

Tom broke up with Mary before her birthday so he wouldn't have to buy her a birthday present.
Even though Mary has turned him down three times already, Tom plans to propose to Mary again.
Rwandan rebels are pushing their offensive south as fighting continues in the capital Kigali.
Tom underwent plastic surgery and changed his identity to evade capture and start a new life.
